title: Trace elements in riparian soils in several localities in Slovenia

author: Milica Marković, Institute for Biological Research "Sinisa Stankovic" (IBISS), University of Belgrade

segmentation: Hi, my name is Melissa.
I'm from Institute for Biological Research's initial stankevitz from Belgrade and I would like to present you my work, trace elements in riparian soils in several localities in Slovenia.

First of all, I would like to tell you that riparian zones are areas between land and aquatic systems such as streams, rivers or lakes, and riparian soils are really important and big parts of those zones and they are under intense pressure from various mostly anthropogenic sources.
So do you know the trace elements are mostly heavy metals and metalloids are one of the most common source of pollution in these zones well?
Our focus was to measure by availability of trace elements, cadmium, chromium, copper, nickel, *NSYNC and to calculate ecological risk.
So we could define the extent of pollution in the summer River riparian zone.

So in order to do that, we conduct our sampling along the Sava River, stretch through Slovenia at 5 sampling sites, Moistener Radovi to Lithia Vallejo and Schottische and we took just topsoil layers of soil and T 230 centimeters depth.
And then.
We just measured by available concentrations of trace elements and total concentrations.
And then we did a ecological risk assessment.

So our results came pretty much interesting because for all sampling sites really because they were in really wide range from absolute no ecological risk to really high risk for soils and generally for environment, and cadmium is really interesting for some sampling sites.
Also, this kind of work is really interesting and important.
Why?
Because this kind of study can show us patterns of distribution of potential contamination or pollution in the riparian zone, especially in the server.
Evil because it is like really crucial for this part of Europe.
And also this kind of study can be basis for further research, not just force of River, but any River in the Europe or world.
I don't know.
And their riparian.
So so if you want to know something more about this work, you can find me at Foster's.
Poster #5 thank you.
